subject: Communication
title: Baseline Reading: The Key to Accuracy
description: A quick, practical guide to Baseline Reading: The Key to Accuracy.

hook.text: Crossed arms don't always mean defensiveness. Sometimes you're just cold. Context is everything.

buildup.text: Reading body language without a baseline is like diagnosing a fever without knowing normal temperature.

discovery.text: A baseline is someone's normal behavior â€” their resting posture, typical gestures, and usual eye contact.

twist.text: Deviations from baseline signal changes in emotion or intent. One crossed-arm moment means nothing alone.

climax.text: Expert analysts spend minutes observing normal behavior before reading any single gesture as meaningful.

punchline.text: Don't read a single cue. Read the change from normal.

quiz.question: Why is establishing a baseline important in body language reading?
options: To detect meaningful deviations from normal behavior
